uk.ac.cam.darknet.backend

Class FacebookDataCollector

  • java.lang.Object
    • uk.ac.cam.darknet.backend.SecondaryDataCollector
      • uk.ac.cam.darknet.backend.FacebookDataCollector
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable, DataCollector

    public class FacebookDataCollector
extends SecondaryDataCollector
    Secondary data collector which gets data from Facebook's public API.
    Author:
    Augustin Zidek

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public void run()

      • setup

        public void setup(java.util.List<Individual> individuals)
        Description copied from interface: DataCollector
        This method is used to setup the collector before it is run in its own thread. Primary data collectors do not need to implement this and should return immediately.
        Parameters:
        individuals - The list of individuals, containing only basic information, whose data should be looked up.

      • getTypeTable

        public Properties getTypeTable()
        Description copied from interface: DataCollector
        This method returns a table of the attributes that this collector supports. The table is a set of key-value pairs, which each key being a string equal to the name of the attribute, and each value being a GlobalAttributeType. The returned Properties object may for example contain the following key-value pairs:
        Attribute Name Global Attribute Type
        twitter.username GlobalAttributeType.USER_NAME
        twitter.displaypic GlobalAttributeType.PHOTO
        ... ...
        Specified by:
        getTypeTable in interface DataCollector
        Overrides:
        getTypeTable in class SecondaryDataCollector
        Returns:
        A Properties object containing all the attributes supported with their global types.

      • getCollectorId

        public java.lang.String getCollectorId()
        Description copied from interface: DataCollector
        Each collector must have a unique ID across the system. The IDs should only contain letters and numbers and are case-insensitive. If two collectors claim the same ID, the data collection manager may refuse to use them.
        Returns:
        The unique ID of the collector.
